before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftsmm","text":"Always wear proper PPE during experiment (gloves, eyewear, lab coat, proper clothing)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6rcv9","text":"This protocol describes use of the cyclic voltammetry (CV) method for electrochemical analysis of laser-inscribed graphene (LIG) electrodes using hexaammine-ruthenium(II) chloride (Hills et al; Oliveira et al). The protocol requires approximately 1 hour (excluding electrode fabrication).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"7so6","text":"The authors acknowledge financial support from the NIFA Agriculture and Food Research Initiative Competitive Grant no. 2018-67016-27578 awarded as a Center of Excellence from the USDA National Institute of Food and Agriculture. The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institute of Food and Agriculture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Electrochemical analysis of laser-inscribed graphene electrodes using cyclic voltammetry (ferri/ferrocyanide redox couple)

funders.funder_name: National Institute of Food and Agriculture

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7lbav","text":"The protocol is based on numerous published manuscripts that use similar methods with the haexamine-ruthenium redox couple, but is not a comprehensive guide. Where appropriate, alternative redox couples or electrolytes are noted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d00c9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

This protocol uses a 7.5 cm long platinum wire or a 3-electrode LIG chip as noted. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d54h1","text":"Prepare LIG electrodes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19l5d","text":"Use protocol for LIG fabrication to prepare a batch of electrodes (link here).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"780ne","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fdj8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7eai8","text":"Expected results from step 1:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bhfj","text":"Fig 1 shows photographs of the instrument and the expected results from a batch fabrication of six replicate electrodes based on the LIG fabrication protocol here ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0q56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dm0m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f81a5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oud4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ftngm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5geea","text":"For quality control process to prepare large batches of LIG electrodes, see Qian et al (2024) (link). As an example, Fig 2 shows a heat map from the auotmated batch clustering tool. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":95,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"94aqv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qvq2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92egu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmrad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DDC8FDF5AAEE11ED96920A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/protocol-l3-1-lig-fabrication-cigiubue"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7mh3e","text":"Wear eyewear protection, gloves, and a lab coat during all experiments.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":335.81818181818176,"id":467148,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"tioc\",\"text\":\"Figure 1. LIG fabrication protocol used to produce a batch of electrodes. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":8}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigqbnd3x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qignbnd3x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigpbnd3x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigmbnd3x.webp","width":484.45901639344424}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1g11c","text":"Store electrodes in a sealed Petri dish or small container until ready for analysis. Be careful not to place heavy or sharp objects on top of the LIG electrodes","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6E73C8CEC25D47949C68CA24D701C68C","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-024-57932-z"}},"5":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":404,"id":467144,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"6o81i\",\"text\":\"Figure 2. Example of output from quality control algorithm by Qian et al (2024). (top) Representative CV showing area between curve (ABC). (bottom) Heat map for replicate electrode selection. Dark red/green images are grouped together as replicates by the dendrogram at the top of the image.\",\"type\":\"unordered-list-item\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":8}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigkbnd3x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigibnd3x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigjbnd3x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qighbnd3x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e720q","text":"Prepare solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94ks6","text":"Gather a sealed glass storage bottle or Falcon tube with at least 50 mL of capacity ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rjdg","text":"Label as 4mM [Ru(NH3)6]Cl2 + 100mM KNO3","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":19,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":21,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":25,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":38,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq9ia","text":"In a separate weigh boat/paper, prepare the following:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2of7e","text":"                1-Weigh 54.6 mg hexamine-ruthenium chloride on a scale.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"m6hr","text":"                2-Weigh 505.5 mg potassium nitrate on a scale.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqvs2","text":"Add the potassium nitrate to the labeled glass bottle. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"305o6","text":"Fill with 25 mL of DI and stir/agitate well until solution is dissolved","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ftfp","text":"Add the hexamine-ruthenium chloride. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1cnv","text":"Fill with an additional 25 mL of DI (50mL total volume) and stir/agitate well until solution is dissolved","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2494i","text":"Transfer 20 mL of the solution to the electrochemical cell (20 mL cell shown in Tang et al protocol)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":80,"length":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"6oq8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3socn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5eak5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"97A05B686A6A4DF5A80AC1CF0E629D6B","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/electrochemical-analysis-of-laser-inscribed-graphe-4r3l27q7jg1y/v1"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":260,"style":"sup"}],"key":"arkcc","text":"Although this protocol uses KNO3, other electrolytes may be used. In general, the electrolyte concentration should generally be greater than 10 µM to avoid migration effects. The electrolyte concentration has an optimum window that should be studied carefully 8.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98ofp","text":"Connect electrodes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ufjt","text":"Assemble electrochemical cell (Benchtop Palmsens4 system):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":58}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35o7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpdph","text":"Single electrode system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn0tf","text":"Connect the single LIG electrode with the potentiostat via the bonding pads using alligator clips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aasvb","text":"Ensure the electrodes are not touching, and the distance between the auxiliary and working electrodes is consistent. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ghmv","text":"Tang et al protocol shows the correct assembly of the electrochemical cell for a single LIG \"dip-style\" electrode, where a Ag/AgCl reference electrode and Pt wire are used as reference and counter electrode, respectively","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"6shrf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1odir","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3nqf6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"97A05B686A6A4DF5A80AC1CF0E629D6B","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/electrochemical-analysis-of-laser-inscribed-graphe-4r3l27q7jg1y/v1"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1o089","text":"The distance between working and reference electrode is an important factor in performance as discussed by Bentley et al. Thus, consistency is critical and care should be taken when using this type of electrochemical cell.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cpecu","text":"Conduct scan (PalmSens4 benchtop system)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj8t2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b1obg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u0dq","text":"Turn on Palmsens hardware and the computer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5ta0","text":"Open the PalmSens software (MultiTrace4 software).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd5sj","text":"Users may operate 3 channels simultaneously or individually","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0afi","text":"Select Cyclic Voltammetry as the Technique. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e42ks","text":"After selecting the mode, set up all parameters. For example, see settings below (see MultiTrace manual for details; link here)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":117,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"57vc9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbpdj","text":" results from PalmSens4 benchtop potentiostat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"472t6","text":"Fig 3 shows the channels connections to the PalmSens, mode selection panel, and operation export to excel icon to export data.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qkr6","text":"When exporting data, make sure all channels' data are The columns show the representative cyclic voltammorgrams of bare LSG electrodes carved at varying pulse widths at a 100 mV/s scan rate as well as the average ESA for each pulse width in (a) the negatively charged ferrocyanide probe and (b) the positively charged ruthenium probe. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":8}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigubnd3x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigsbnd3x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigtbnd3x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qigrbnd3x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27itd","text":"Clean workspace (Timing: 5 min)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an6s2","text":"Ensure chemicals are stored or discarded correctly, and turn off Palmsens and the computer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aurcn","text":"If using external reference and auxiliary electrodes, clean them up with DI water and store them in the appropriate place. Reference electrodes should be stored with a 3M KCl solution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7ult","text":"Wipe the working desk with 75 % alcohol.
